metadata.titleEn: Qilian Mountains integrated observatory network: Dataset of Heihe integrated observatory network (automatic weather station of Huazhaizi desert steppe station, 2020)
metadata.titleCn: 祁连山综合观测网：黑河流域地表过程综合观测网（花寨子荒漠站自动气象站-2020）
metadata.description:
This dataset includes data recorded by the Heihe integrated observatory network obtained from the automatic weather station (AWS) at the observation system of Meteorological elements gradient of Huazhaizi desert steppe station from January 1 to December 31, 2020. The site (100.3201°E, 38.7659°N) was located on a desert steppe surface in the Huazhaizi, which is near Zhangye city, Gansu Province. The elevation is 1731 m. The installation heights and orientations of different sensors and measured quantities were as follows: air temperature and humidity profile (HMP45AC; 5 and 10 m, north), wind speed and direction profile (windsonic; 5 and 10 m, north), air pressure (CS100; 2 m), rain gauge (TE525M; 10 m), four-component radiometer (CNR1; 6 m, south), two infrared temperature sensors (SI-111; 6 m, south, vertically downward), soil heat flux (HFP01; 3 duplicates, -0.06 m), soil temperature profile (109ss-L; 0, -0.02, -0.04, -0.1, -0.2, -0.4, -0.6, -1.0 m), soil moisture profile (ML3; -0.02, -0.04, -0.1, -0.2, -0.4, -0.6, -1.0 m).
The observations included the following: air temperature and humidity (Ta_5 m and Ta_10 m; RH_5 m and RH_10 m) (℃ and %, respectively), wind speed (Ws_5 m and Ws_10 m) (m/s), wind direction (WD_5 m and WD_10 m) (°), air pressure (press) (hpa), precipitation (rain) (mm), four-component radiation (DR, incoming shortwave radiation; UR, outgoing shortwave radiation; DLR_Cor, incoming longwave radiation; ULR_Cor, outgoing longwave radiation; Rn, net radiation) (W/m^2), infrared temperature (IRT_1 and IRT_2) (℃), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, and Gs_3) (W/m^2), soil temperature (Ts_0 cm, Ts_2 cm, Ts_4 cm, Ts_10 cm, Ts_20 cm, Ts_40 cm, Ts_60 cm, Ts_100 cm) (℃), soil moisture (Ms_2 cm, Ms_4 cm, Ms_10 cm, Ms_20 cm, Ms_40 cm, Ms_60 cm, Ms_100 cm) (%).
The data processing and quality control steps were as follows: (1) The AWS data were averaged over intervals of 10 min for a total of 144 records per day. The missing data were denoted by -6999. Due to the malfunction of sensors, data during 1.14-1.17 and 5.11-5.16 were missing; (2) Data in duplicate records were rejected. (3) Unphysical data were rejected. (4) The data marked in red are problematic data. (5) The format of the date and time was unified, and the date and time were collected in the same column, for example, date and time: 2020-6-10 10:30. (6) Finally, the naming convention was AWS+ site no. Moreover, suspicious data were marked in red.
For more information, please refer to Liu et al. (2018) (for sites information), Liu et al. (2011) for data processing) in the Citation section.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2020年1月1日至2020年12月31日黑河流域地表过程综合观测网中游花寨子荒漠站气象要素观测数据。站点位于甘肃省张掖市花寨子，下垫面是盐爪爪山前荒漠。观测点的经纬度是100.3201E, 38.7659N，海拔1731m。空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在5m、10m处，朝向正北；气压计安装防水箱内；翻斗式雨量计安装在10m处；风速风向传感器架设在5m、10m处，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm和100cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分传感器分别埋设在地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm和100cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_5m、RH_5m、Ta_10m、RH_10m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_5m、WS_10m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_5m、WD_10m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤水分（Ms_2cm、Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_60cm、Ms_100cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比)和土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_60cm、Ts_100cm）（单位：摄氏度）。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；风速风向偶尔出现一些错误值，由于传感器的问题，1.14-1.17和5.11-5.16数据出现错误值；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2020-6-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称
黑河综合观测网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区大约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是经济发展的基础，特别是在中国西部，自古以来就是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠地区被先前的研究者发现是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展是非常重要的。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频繁发生，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013），咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包含2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，风速和风向的梯度；空气压力、降水和土壤湿度剖面）通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期进行观测，同时也记录了地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括HRB的中下游，位于中国西部的干旱地区，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了共11个地表通量和气象站——2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Concept Completion.AnswerEn: Eddy covariance system, scintillometer, automatic weather stations
Concept Completion.AnswerCn: 涡度相关系统，闪烁仪，自动气象站

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: What challenges do inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas face concerning ecological environment degradation?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临的生态环境退化挑战有哪些？
Concept Completion.AnswerEn: drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, frequent dust storms
Concept Completion.AnswerCn: 河流和湖泊干涸，自然植被退化，土地荒漠化加剧，频繁的沙尘暴。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to observe energy and water vapor exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个用于观察绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量和水蒸气交换的数据收集方法的示例？
Example.AnswerEn: A suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems includes half-hourly turbulent flux data acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer, as well as hydrometeorological data observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period.
Example.AnswerCn: 一套来自人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统的观测数据集包括通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的半小时湍流通量数据，以及从自动气象站观测的10分钟平均的水文气象数据。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced in ecological data collection in inland river basins of arid and semi-arid areas?
Example.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区的内陆河流流域，生态数据收集面临的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas face ecological environment degradation challenges, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent dust storms, especially in basins like the Tarim River, Aral Sea, and Lake Urmia.
Example.AnswerCn: 内陆河流盆地在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的挑战，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴，尤其是在塔里木河、咸海和乌尔米湖等盆地。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you give an example of a dataset that includes long-term observations of carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个包含绿洲-沙漠地区碳交换长期观测的示例数据集？
Example.AnswerEn: A dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas, which includes fluxes, hydrometeorological data, and vegetation and soil parameters, is available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
Example.AnswerCn: 一个关于绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测的数据集，包括通量、气象水文数据以及植被和土壤参数，现已从国家西藏高原数据中心提供。

Quantification.QuestionEn: What is the frequency of data collection for meteorological elements at the automatic weather stations?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 自动气象站对气象要素的数据收集频率是多少？

Definition.QuestionEn: What are 'hydrometeorological data' in the context of oasis–desert systems?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统的背景下，“水文气象数据”指的是与水文和气象相关的数据，包括降水量、蒸发量、土壤湿度、温度、风速和湿度等信息，这些数据对于理解和管理这些生态系统的水资源和气候变化具有重要意义。
Definition.AnswerEn: In the context of oasis–desert systems, 'hydrometeorological data' refer to observations related to radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, gradients of air temperature and humidity, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles. These data are typically collected from automatic weather stations with a 10-minute average period.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统的背景下，“水文气象数据”是指与辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度和湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水量以及土壤湿度剖面相关的观测数据。这些数据通常通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期进行收集。

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'eddy covariance system' mean in the context of data collection methods?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在数据收集方法的上下文中，“涡度协方差系统”指的是一种用于测量气体交换（如二氧化碳和水蒸气）与大气之间的系统。
Definition.AnswerEn: An 'eddy covariance system' is a data collection method that involves acquiring half-hourly turbulent flux data, particularly for energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes. This system is used to measure and analyze exchanges between the surface and the atmosphere over oasis–desert systems.
Definition.AnswerCn: “涡度协方差系统”是一种数据收集方法，涉及获取半小时的湍流通量数据，特别是能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量。该系统用于测量和分析绿洲-沙漠系统表面与大气之间的交换。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is meant by 'data processing and quality control procedure' in the context of observational datasets?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在观察性数据集的背景下，“数据处理和质量控制程序”是指对收集到的数据进行整理、清洗、分析和验证的系统性步骤，以确保数据的准确性、一致性和可靠性。这些程序通常包括数据录入、缺失值处理、异常值检测、数据标准化和验证等环节，以提高数据的质量和可用性。
Definition.AnswerEn: In the context of observational datasets, 'data processing and quality control procedure' refers to the steps taken to ensure the accuracy and reliability of data, which include data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing. These procedures are crucial for maintaining the integrity of datasets related to energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在观测数据集的背景下，“数据处理和质量控制程序”是指确保数据准确性和可靠性的步骤，包括数据收集、数据处理以及数据归档和共享。这些程序对于维护与绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换相关的数据集的完整性至关重要。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How does the data collection method of using automatic weather stations in oasis-desert areas compare to the use of eddy covariance systems in terms of capturing energy and water vapor fluxes?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区，使用自动气象站的数据收集方法与使用涡度协方差系统在捕捉能量和水汽通量方面的比较如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Automatic weather stations, as used in the field above, provide hydrometeorological data like radiation and soil temperature profiles with a 10-minute average period. In contrast, eddy covariance systems capture half-hourly turbulent flux data, which include energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, offering more direct measurements of these fluxes compared to the averaged data from weather stations.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 自动气象站在上述领域中提供水文气象数据，如辐射和土壤温度剖面，平均周期为10分钟。相比之下，涡度协方差系统捕获半小时的湍流通量数据，包括能量、水蒸气和碳通量，提供比气象站的平均数据更直接的这些通量测量。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in data processing and quality control techniques between datasets collected in the Heihe River Basin and those from other inland river basins facing ecological degradation?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在黑河流域收集的数据与其他面临生态退化的内陆河流域的数据处理和质量控制技术之间有什么区别？
Comparison.AnswerEn: In the Heihe River Basin, data processing involves ensuring a certain number of data points per day, marking missing data, and removing erroneous or duplicate data. This systematic approach might differ from other basins where data processing could vary based on specific regional challenges such as more frequent dust storms or differing vegetation types, impacting the kind of errors or data loss encountered.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在黑河流域，数据处理涉及确保每天有一定数量的数据点，标记缺失数据，并删除错误或重复的数据。这种系统化的方法可能与其他流域有所不同，因为其他流域的数据处理可能会根据特定的区域挑战而有所变化，例如更频繁的沙尘暴或不同的植被类型，这会影响所遇到的错误或数据丢失的类型。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the challenges of maintaining ecological balance in oasis-desert systems compare with those in other arid inland river basins, such as the Tarim River basin?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中维持生态平衡的挑战与其他干旱内陆河流流域（如塔里木河流域）相比如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Both oasis-desert systems and other arid inland river basins face challenges like river drying and land desertification. However, oasis-desert systems are unique in that they play a crucial role in supporting a majority of the population in arid regions, which adds socio-economic pressure to maintain ecological stability. This contrasts with other basins where the focus might be more on ecological impacts rather than immediate socio-economic dependencies.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 绿洲-沙漠系统和其他干旱内陆河流流域面临着河流干涸和土地沙漠化等挑战。然而，绿洲-沙漠系统的独特之处在于它们在支持干旱地区大多数人口方面发挥着关键作用，这增加了维持生态稳定的社会经济压力。这与其他流域形成对比，后者可能更关注生态影响，而不是直接的社会经济依赖。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How do the observed long-term patterns in air temperature and soil moisture data from meteorological stations inform us about the interactions between oasis and desert ecosystems?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 观察到的气温和土壤湿度数据的长期模式如何为我们提供关于绿洲和沙漠生态系统之间相互作用的信息？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The observed long-term patterns in air temperature and soil moisture data can provide insights into the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange dynamics in oasis–desert ecosystems. These patterns help researchers understand the balance required for sustainable oasis development and the ecological stability of these regions.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 观察到的长期气温和土壤湿度数据模式可以为研究绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换动态提供洞察。这些模式帮助研究人员理解可持续绿洲发展的所需平衡以及这些地区的生态稳定性。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise in collecting continuous and accurate data in arid inland river basins, and how can these be mitigated?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在干旱内陆河流流域收集连续和准确数据时可能会出现哪些挑战，以及如何减轻这些挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Challenges in data collection in arid inland river basins include ecological degradation, such as drying rivers and intensified desertification. These can be mitigated by using robust quality control methods, such as ensuring data completeness, removing erroneous data, and maintaining consistent data formats.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 在干旱内陆河流流域，数据收集面临的挑战包括生态退化，如河流干涸和沙漠化加剧。这些问题可以通过使用稳健的质量控制方法来缓解，例如确保数据的完整性、去除错误数据以及保持数据格式的一致性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why do errors occur in the data collected from automatic weather stations, particularly in the context of oasis–desert systems?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 自动气象站收集的数据中为什么会出现错误，特别是在绿洲-沙漠系统的背景下？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Errors in data collection from automatic weather stations can occur due to sensor malfunctions, environmental interference, and extreme weather conditions that are prevalent in oasis–desert systems, which can disrupt the accuracy and reliability of the measurements.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 自动气象站的数据收集错误可能由于传感器故障、环境干扰以及在绿洲-沙漠系统中常见的极端天气条件而发生，这些因素可能会干扰测量的准确性和可靠性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the complexity of understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的复杂性涉及哪些因素？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The complexity arises from the intricate interactions between the diverse ecological components of oasis–desert ecosystems, including varying soil moisture levels, vegetation types, atmospheric conditions, and the unique balance between oasis and desert areas, all of which require comprehensive long-term observations to accurately assess their energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 复杂性源于绿洲-沙漠生态系统中多样生态成分之间错综复杂的相互作用，包括不同的土壤湿度水平、植被类型、大气条件，以及绿洲与沙漠区域之间的独特平衡，这些都需要全面的长期观测来准确评估它们的能量、水蒸气和碳交换。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of utilizing automatic weather stations for data collection in oasis-desert ecosystems on the understanding of climate interactions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中利用自动气象站进行数据收集对气候相互作用理解的潜在后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Utilizing automatic weather stations for data collection in oasis-desert ecosystems allows for continuous and precise monitoring of climate interactions, including energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges. This can significantly enhance the understanding of these interactions, contributing to the recognition of oasis-desert dynamics and aiding in the ecological stability and sustainable development of oases.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 利用自动气象站在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中进行数据收集，可以实现对气候相互作用的持续和精确监测，包括能量、水蒸气和碳的交换。这可以显著增强对这些相互作用的理解，有助于认识绿洲-沙漠的动态，并促进绿洲的生态稳定和可持续发展。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What outcomes can be expected from long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes in oasis-desert systems regarding ecological and socioeconomic development?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 对绿洲-沙漠系统中能量、水蒸气和碳通量的长期观察可以预期以下结果，涉及生态和社会经济发展：
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes in oasis-desert systems can lead to improved understanding of ecological dynamics and contribute to the goal of sustainable oasis development. These observations are crucial for maintaining the balance between oasis and desert systems, supporting ecological security, and promoting socioeconomic development by providing data-driven insights for policy and management strategies.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 对绿洲-沙漠系统中能量、水汽和碳通量的长期观测可以加深对生态动态的理解，并有助于可持续绿洲发展的目标。这些观测对于维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡、支持生态安全以及促进社会经济发展至关重要，因为它们为政策和管理策略提供了基于数据的见解。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the primary objectives of collecting meteorological and soil parameter data in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中收集气象和土壤参数数据的主要目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The primary objectives include understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems to support ecological security and sustainable development. This understanding is crucial for recognizing oasis–desert interactions and achieving goals such as carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in these regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 主要目标包括理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，以支持生态安全和可持续发展。这种理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠相互作用以及实现这些地区碳达峰和碳中和等目标至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the intended outcomes of establishing multiple land surface flux and meteorological stations in the arid regions of western China?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在中国西部干旱地区建立多个地表通量和气象站的预期结果是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The intended outcomes include collecting comprehensive datasets of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations. These datasets aim to provide critical insights into the interactions within oasis–desert areas, which can significantly affect the carbon balance and contribute to global carbon cycle understanding, thereby supporting the ecological environment and economic development in these regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 预期成果包括收集能源、水汽和碳交换观测的综合数据集。这些数据集旨在提供对绿洲-沙漠地区相互作用的关键见解，这些相互作用可能显著影响碳平衡，并有助于全球碳循环的理解，从而支持这些地区的生态环境和经济发展。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are involved in ensuring the quality control of meteorological data collected in arid regions, especially when dealing with erroneous values from sensors?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 确保在干旱地区收集的气象数据质量控制的程序包括哪些步骤，特别是在处理传感器错误值时？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The data processing and quality control procedures include ensuring that each day has 144 data entries (one every 10 minutes), marking missing data with -6999, removing duplicate records, deleting data that are beyond physical significance or instrument range, marking questionable data in red, and standardizing the date and time format.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 数据处理和质量控制程序包括确保每天有144个数据条目（每10分钟一个），用-6999标记缺失数据，删除重复记录，删除超出物理意义或仪器范围的数据，用红色标记可疑数据，以及标准化日期和时间格式。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the key steps in the data collection and archiving process for long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange datasets in oasis–desert systems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn:
在绿洲-沙漠系统中，长期能源、水汽和碳交换数据集的数据收集和归档过程的关键步骤包括：

1. 确定研究目标和数据需求
2. 选择合适的监测站点和设备
3. 进行现场数据收集
4. 数据质量控制和校正
5. 数据存储和管理
6. 数据归档和备份
7. 数据共享和发布
8. 定期更新和维护数据集
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The data collection process involves acquiring half-hourly turbulent flux data using an eddy covariance system and scintillometer, alongside hydrometeorological data every 10 minutes from automatic weather stations. This data is then processed, archived, and shared, with vegetation and soil parameters supplemented in the datasets.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 数据收集过程涉及使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取半小时的湍流通量数据，同时每10分钟从自动气象站收集水文气象数据。然后对这些数据进行处理、归档和共享，并在数据集中补充植被和土壤参数。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What methodologies enable the comprehensive monitoring of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些方法能够全面监测绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换？
Enablement.AnswerEn: A suite of observational datasets comprising long-term energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes, as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters, enable comprehensive monitoring. Data is acquired using eddy covariance systems and scintillometers, with additional hydrometeorological data collected from automatic weather stations set to a 10-minute average period.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 一套观测数据集包括长期的能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据，能够进行全面监测。数据通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取，此外，自动气象站收集的水文气象数据以10分钟的平均周期进行记录。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological systems are crucial for enabling long-term data collection in harsh, arid environments such as oasis-desert systems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 在严酷的干旱环境中，例如绿洲-沙漠系统，哪些技术系统对于长期数据收集至关重要？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Automatic weather stations with sensors measuring various meteorological and soil parameters are crucial for long-term data collection in these environments. These stations collect data on air temperature, humidity, wind speed, direction, air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles, contributing to the understanding of ecological and meteorological dynamics in oasis-desert systems.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 自动气象站配备传感器，测量各种气象和土壤参数，对于这些环境中的长期数据收集至关重要。这些站点收集空气温度、湿度、风速、风向、气压、降水量和土壤湿度剖面等数据，有助于理解绿洲-沙漠系统中的生态和气象动态。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do data processing and quality control methods enable the reliability and accuracy of datasets collected in arid regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 数据处理和质量控制方法如何提高在干旱地区收集的数据集的可靠性和准确性？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The data processing and quality control methods, which include ensuring consistent data collection, removing erroneous values, and standardizing data formats, enable the reliability and accuracy of datasets. Steps such as marking missing data, removing duplicate records, and eliminating physically implausible measurements are essential for maintaining the integrity of datasets collected in challenging environments.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 数据处理和质量控制方法，包括确保一致的数据收集、去除错误值和标准化数据格式，能够提高数据集的可靠性和准确性。标记缺失数据、去除重复记录和消除物理上不合理的测量等步骤对于维护在困难环境中收集的数据集的完整性至关重要。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be difficulties in ensuring the quality and completeness of data collected from automatic weather stations in arid and semi-arid regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，从自动气象站收集的数据质量和完整性可能存在困难的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Challenges such as sensor errors, data loss, and environmental degradation in arid and semi-arid regions can affect data quality. The metadata notes issues like sensor errors causing incorrect wind speed and direction values, and missing data is marked with placeholders, indicating potential gaps or inaccuracies in the dataset.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，传感器错误、数据丢失和环境退化等挑战可能会影响数据质量。元数据中提到了一些问题，例如传感器错误导致风速和风向值不正确，缺失的数据用占位符标记，表示数据集中可能存在的空白或不准确之处。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why could long-term observational data be crucial for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 长期观测数据对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换至关重要，原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Long-term observations are indispensable for achieving a quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange, which is significant for recognizing oasis–desert interactions and maintaining ecological stability and socioeconomic development in arid regions, as stated in the relevant papers.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 长期观测对于实现对能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解至关重要，这对于认识绿洲-沙漠相互作用以及维持干旱地区的生态稳定和社会经济发展具有重要意义，如相关论文所述。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What reasons could there be for the emphasis on collecting auxiliary data involving vegetation and soil parameters alongside hydrometeorological data in oasis–desert systems?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，强调收集与水文气象数据同时涉及植被和土壤参数的辅助数据的原因可能有哪些？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Including auxiliary data such as vegetation and soil parameters enhances the dataset's comprehensiveness, allowing for a more detailed analysis of the interactions within oasis–desert ecosystems, which is crucial for understanding the ecological balance and supporting sustainable development in these areas.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 包括植被和土壤参数等辅助数据可以增强数据集的全面性，从而更详细地分析绿洲-沙漠生态系统内的相互作用，这对于理解生态平衡和支持这些地区的可持续发展至关重要。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In your opinion, what are the major challenges faced in collecting long-term observational datasets in oasis–desert systems, and how might these be addressed?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在收集绿洲-沙漠系统的长期观测数据集时，面临的主要挑战是什么？这些挑战可能如何得到解决？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Major challenges in collecting long-term observational datasets in oasis–desert systems include ecological degradation such as river and lake drying and land desertification. Addressing these challenges requires maintaining the balance between oasis and desert systems through sustainable development practices and proper data collection techniques.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中收集长期观察数据集的主要挑战包括生态退化，如河流和湖泊干涸以及土地沙漠化。应对这些挑战需要通过可持续发展实践和适当的数据收集技术来维持绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your assessment of the current state of available datasets for studying energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas, and what improvements could be made?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 我对研究绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的可用数据集的当前状态的评估是什么，以及可以做出哪些改进？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The available datasets provide valuable insights into energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas, particularly with the establishment of multiple land surface flux and meteorological stations. However, improvements could be made by expanding the temporal and spatial coverage of datasets and incorporating additional environmental parameters to enhance the understanding of oasis–desert interactions.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 可用的数据集为绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换提供了宝贵的见解，特别是随着多个地表通量和气象站的建立。然而，通过扩展数据集的时间和空间覆盖范围，并纳入更多环境参数，可以改善对绿洲-沙漠相互作用的理解。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't figure out how data quality control is maintained during the collection of meteorological parameters in arid regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法弄清楚在干旱地区收集气象参数时如何保持数据质量控制。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The data quality control involves ensuring a consistent number of data points daily, marking missing data with specific indicators, removing duplicate records and out-of-range values, and using uniform date and time formats. Special attention is given to sensor-related errors and marking questionable data distinctly.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 数据质量控制涉及确保每天有一致数量的数据点，用特定指标标记缺失数据，删除重复记录和超出范围的值，并使用统一的日期和时间格式。特别关注传感器相关错误，并明确标记可疑数据。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand the challenges faced when collecting long-term hydrometeorological data in oasis–desert ecosystems.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不理解在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中收集长期水文气象数据时面临的挑战。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Challenges include ecological degradation issues such as drying rivers, vegetation loss, land desertification, and dust storms, which are prevalent in arid inland river basins. These environmental conditions can impact the stability and reliability of data collection.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 挑战包括生态退化问题，如河流干涸、植被丧失、土地沙漠化和沙尘暴，这些问题在干旱的内陆河流流域中普遍存在。这些环境条件可能会影响数据收集的稳定性和可靠性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about how datasets involving energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes are structured and shared for research in semiarid regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不确定涉及能量、水蒸气和碳通量的数据集在半干旱地区的研究中是如何结构和共享的。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Datasets from oasis–desert systems typically include long-term measurements of energy, water vapor, and carbon and methane fluxes, as well as supplementary hydrometeorological, vegetation, and soil parameter data. They are structured to include half-hourly and average period data and are shared through platforms like the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 来自绿洲-沙漠系统的数据集通常包括能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量的长期测量，以及补充的水文气象、植被和土壤参数数据。它们的结构包括半小时和平均周期数据，并通过国家西藏高原数据中心等平台共享。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore the data collection methods used for observing energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert areas, focusing on the sensors and instruments deployed.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨用于观察绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水蒸气和碳交换的数据收集方法，重点关注所部署的传感器和仪器。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The data collection methods for observing energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert areas include using an eddy covariance system and scintillometer for acquiring half-hourly turbulent flux data. Automatic weather stations provide hydrometeorological data such as radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, air temperature and humidity gradients, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles, with a 10-minute average period.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区观察能量、水蒸气和碳交换的数据收集方法包括使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取半小时的湍流通量数据。自动气象站提供水文气象数据，如辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度和湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面，平均周期为10分钟。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please identify potential datasets that can be used to study the interactions between oasis and desert systems, and discuss their availability.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请识别可以用于研究绿洲与沙漠系统之间相互作用的潜在数据集，并讨论它们的可用性。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets for studying oasis-desert interactions include long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, along with auxiliary hydrometeorological, vegetation, and soil parameters data from 2012 to 2021. These datasets are available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center and comprise data collected from 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations in the arid regions of western China.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 研究绿洲-沙漠相互作用的潜在数据集包括2012年至2021年的能量、水汽和碳通量的长期观测数据，以及辅助的水文气象、植被和土壤参数数据。这些数据集来自国家西藏高原数据中心，包含了来自中国西部干旱地区11个地表通量和气象站收集的数据。
